alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Northwest Fayette; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Mason, Kanawha, Putnam, northeastern Lincoln, southwestern Roane, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Fayette and northern Boone Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from Madison north to Liberty, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Winfield, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, Poca, East Bank, Glasgow and Smithers. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 130. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 38 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 71 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 52 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
